quiz.question: A filled area is described by polygons in most graphics routines.
A polygon is defined by a set of two or more vertices connected by edges.
A convex polygon has all interior angles less than or equal to 180 degrees.
Concave polygons are easier to fill than convex polygons.
One method to identify a concave polygon is to check if extending an edge intersects other edges.
The cross product method for splitting concave polygons works by calculating edge vectors and their cross products.
The odd-parity rule states that a point is interior if the number of intersections with polygon edges is even.
quiz.section: INCLUSION OF A POINT IN POLYGON

quiz.question: In the nonzero winding number rule, a point is interior if its winding number is zero.
quiz.section: INCLUSION OF A POINT IN POLYGON

quiz.question: The scan-line fill algorithm works by intersecting scan lines with polygon edges and filling between pairs of intersections.
The scan-line algorithm processes the polygon from its leftmost to its rightmost vertex.
The active edge table (AET) stores all edges of the polygon, not just those intersecting the current scan line.
The global edge table (GET) has one bucket for each scan line, storing edges that have that scan line as their y-min value.
Boundary fill algorithm is used when the region has a single-color boundary.
In 4-connected boundary fill, only the up, down, left, and right neighbors are considered.
Flood fill algorithm is suitable for regions with multi-colored boundaries.
The flood fill algorithm starts from a boundary pixel and fills outward.
Span flood-fill algorithm fills horizontal pixel spans instead of individual pixels to reduce stacking.
Pattern fill is a style where the polygon is filled with a predefined pattern.
In the RGB color model, (1,1,0) represents the color yellow.
The CMY color model is an additive color model.
HSV stands for Hue, Saturation, and Value.
Saturation in HSV refers to the brightness of a color.
The interior of a self-intersecting polygon can be correctly identified using the odd-even rule.
quiz.section: INCLUSION OF A POINT IN POLYGON

quiz.question: The winding number for an exterior point is always zero.
quiz.section: INCLUSION OF A POINT IN POLYGON

quiz.question: Scan-line algorithms are only used for convex polygons.
The active edge table is updated as the scan line moves upward.
In boundary fill, 8-connected filling considers diagonal neighbors in addition to orthogonal ones.
Flood fill replaces a specified interior color with the desired fill color.
RGB is a subtractive color model used in printing.
Cyan, magenta, and yellow are the primary colors in the subtractive CMY model.
Value in HSV corresponds to the intensity or brightness of a color.
A polygon must have at least four vertices.
Surface tessellation refers to approximating a surface with polygons.
The rotational method for splitting concave polygons rotates the polygon so that each vertex is placed at the origin.
In the odd-parity rule, if a point is on the boundary, it is considered interior.
quiz.section: INCLUSION OF A POINT IN POLYGON

quiz.question: The scan-line algorithm handles special cases at vertices by counting them as two intersections.
The global edge table stores the slope (1/m) for each edge.
Boundary fill algorithm uses a stack to store neighboring pixels for processing.
Flood fill can be implemented recursively or iteratively.
Hollow filling means only the boundary of the polygon is drawn.
In RGB, (0,0,0) represents white.
In CMY, (0,0,0) represents white.
Hue in HSV represents the dominant wavelength of the color.
The scan-line algorithm is used only for monochrome displays.
The active edge table is sorted by the y-max values of edges.
Boundary fill algorithm may fail if the interior and boundary colors are the same.
Flood fill is generally faster than boundary fill for simple polygons.
In 8-connected filling, the fill can leak through diagonal gaps in the boundary.
The span flood-fill algorithm reduces memory usage by stacking only the start of spans.
Color models like RGB and CMY are device-dependent.
